meanings.sent1: I will lead the tour group through the museum.
meanings.sent2: She will lead the team to victory with her skills.
meanings.sent3: The duckling tried to lead the other animals, thinking it was the boss.
meanings.sent4: Her bright smile will lead you to the right path.
meanings.sent5: The lighthouse's beam of light will lead ships safely to shore.

meanings.sent1: The toy soldier was made of lead.
meanings.sent2: The roof was damaged by the weight of the lead.
meanings.sent3: The lead sinker made the fishing line sink quickly.
meanings.sent4: His heart felt heavy as if made of lead.
meanings.sent5: The artist used lead to create a sculpture of a lion.

meanings.definition: The first position in a competition
meanings.sent1: She took the lead in the race right from the start.
meanings.sent2: The team fought hard to maintain their lead in the game.
meanings.sent3: The lead runner was so fast, it seemed like he had wings.
meanings.sent4: His lead in the competition was unbreakable.
meanings.sent5: The lead singer of the band captivated the audience with her voice.

meanings.definition: A thin strip of metal used in stained glass
meanings.sent1: The stained glass window was adorned with lead strips.
meanings.sent2: She carefully soldered the lead to hold the glass pieces together.
meanings.sent3: The lead strip added a beautiful outline to the artwork.
meanings.sent4: The intricate design required precise placement of the lead strips.
meanings.sent5: The lead lining gave the stained glass a classic look.

meanings.definition: To be in charge or command
meanings.sent1: He will lead the project team to success.
meanings.sent2: The captain will lead the crew through the storm.
meanings.sent3: The teacher will lead the class in a fun science experiment.
meanings.sent4: Her confidence will lead the team to victory.
meanings.sent5: The general will lead the troops into battle.
